summary.seg: This manuscript contains the Pauline Epistles, transcribed from the Codex Boernerianus, a 9th-century bilingual manuscript. That manuscript is believed to have been written by an Irish monk working at the Monastery of St Gall in Switzerland. Its Greek text is provided with a Latin gloss in a script of Anglo-Saxon type. The transcription preserved in Trinity College, MS B.17.2 was produced around 1719 for the scholar Richard Bentley, who was then planning a new edition of the Greek New Testament and gathering materials for the purpose. This copy closely imitates the script and layout of the original, observing the same page and line breaks.

In the Codex Boernerianus the text of the Epistles is followed by a heading for the apocryphal Letter to the Laodikeans, a text which circulated in Latin in association with the Vulgate translation of the New Testament. However, the text which follows the heading is actually part of a Latin commentary on the Gospel of Matthew. In this transcript, only the first few lines of this text have been reproduced, presumably because the copyist realised that its content was not relevant to the copy's purpose. Another portion of this commentary, on folios which precede the text of the Epistles in the Codex Boernerianus, had also been omitted. However, the transcript does reproduce, on f. 23r, a short poem in Old Irish disparaging the practice of pilgrimage to Rome, which had been added in the margin of the exemplar.

msItem.title: Pauline Epistles
msItem.filiation: The text was copied from Dresden, Sächsische Landesbibliothek – Staats- und Universitätsbibliothek Dresden (SLUB), MS A.145b (Codex Boernerianus).
msItem.note: As in the exemplar, the Greek text is supplied with an interlinear Latin gloss. There are lacunas where space has been left blank, including entire blank folios, corresponding to portions of the exemplar which had been rendered illegible by damage

msItem.title: Letter to the Romans
msItem.note: Begins incomplete, at the same point as the exemplar (Rom 1:5)
msItem.rubric: f. 1r Παυλος δουλος Ιησου Χριστου κλητος αποστολος
msItem.incipit: f. 1r εν πασιν τοις εθνεσιν υπερ του ονοματος αυτου
msItem.explicit: f. 21r Η χαρις του Κυριου ημων μετα παντων υμων· Αμην

msItem.title: First Letter to the Corinthians
msItem.incipit: f. 21r Παυλος κλητος αποστολος· Χριστου Ιησου· δια θεληματος· Θεου
msItem.explicit: f. 40v Η αγαπη μου μετα παντων ὐμων· εν Χριστω Ιησου

msItem.title: Old Irish poem
msItem.explicit: f. 23r beith fo étoil· maíc· maire

msItem.title: Second Letter to the Corinthians
msItem.rubric: f. 40v Αρχεται προς Κορινθιους δευτερον βʹ
msItem.incipit: f. 41r Παυλος αποστολος Ιησου Χριστου δια θεληματος Θεου
msItem.explicit: f. 53v και· η· κοινωνία τοῦ Αγειου Πνευματος. μετα παντων υμων

msItem.title: Letter to the Galatians
msItem.incipit: f. 53v Παυλος αποστολος ουκ απανθρωπων ουδε δια ανθρωπου
msItem.explicit: f. 60v Η χαρις. του· Κυριου ημων Ιησου· Χριστου· μετα του πνευματος· υμων αδελφοι ἀμήν

msItem.title: Letter to the Ephesians
msItem.incipit: f. 109r Παυλος αποστολος Ιησου Χριστου δια θελημτος Θεου τοις αγιοις τοις ουσιν εν· Εφεσω
msItem.explicit: f. 68v Η χαρῖς μετα παντων των αγαπων τον· Κυριον ημων Ιησον Χριστον εν· αφθαρσια

msItem.title: Letter to the Philippians
msItem.incipit: f. 68v Παυλος και Τιμοθεος δουλοι Ιησου Χριστου πασιν τοις αγιοις εν Χριστω Ιησου τοις ουσῖν· εν Φιλιπποις
msItem.explicit: f. 73r Μαλλειστα δε οι εκ της Καισαρος οικιας· Η χαρις του Κυριου Ιησου Χριστου μετα του πνευματος υμων

msItem.title: Letter to the Colossians
msItem.incipit: f. 73v Παυλος αποστολος Χριστου Ιησου δια θεληματος Θεου και Τιμοθεος. ο αδελφος
msItem.explicit: f. 78r Μνημονευεται· μου των δεσμων χαρις μεθυμων

msItem.title: First Letter to the Thessalonians
msItem.rubric: f. 78r Αρχεται Θεσσαλονικαιους αʹ πρωτη επιστολη
msItem.incipit: f. 78v Παυλος και Σιλβανος και Τιμοθεος· τη· ἐκκλησια· Θεσσαλονικαιων
msItem.explicit: f. 83r αναγνωσθηναι την επιστολην πασιν τοις αδελφοις. Η χαρις του Κυριου ημων Ιησου Χριστου μεθυμων

msItem.title: Second Letter to the Thessalonians
msItem.incipit: f. 83r Παυλος και Σιλβανος και Τιμοθεος τη· εκκλησεια Θεσσαλονικαιων
msItem.explicit: f. 85v ουτως γραφω Η χαρεις του Κυριου Ιησου Χριστου μετα παντων υμων· αμην

msItem.title: First Letter to Timothy
msItem.incipit: f. 86r Παυλος αποστολος Ιησου Χριστου κατεπιταγην Θεου Σωτηρος ημων
msItem.explicit: f. 91v ην τινες επαγγελλομενοι περι την πιστιν ηστοχησαν· Η χαρις μεθυμων

msItem.title: Second Letter to Timothy
msItem.incipit: f. 91v Παυλος αποστολος Ιησου Χριστου δια θεληματος Θεου
msItem.explicit: f. 96r Ο Κυριος μετα του πνευματος. σου Η χαρις· μεθυμων

msItem.title: Letter to Titus
msItem.incipit: f. 96r Παυλος δουλος Θεου αποστολος δε Ιησου Χριστου κατα πιστιν εκλεκτων Θεου
msItem.explicit: f. 98v Ασπασε τους φιλουντας ημας εν πιστι Η χαρεις του Θεου μετα παντων υμων Αμην

msItem.title: Letter to Philemon
msItem.note: Ends incomplete, at the same point as in the exemplar (Phm 1:20)
msItem.incipit: f. 98v Παυλος δεσμειος Χριστου Ιησου· και Τειμοθεος ο αδελφος· Φιλημονει τω· αγαπητω
msItem.explicit: f. 99v αναπαυσον· μου· τα· σπαχνα· εν· Χριστω

msItem.title: Letter to the Laodikeans
msItem.note: As in the exemplar, only the heading to this apocryphal text is present

msItem.title: Commentary on the Gospel of Matthew
msItem.note: While more of this text is present in the exemplar, only the first few lines have been copied here

support.material: Western paper, folded in quarto. Watermark: Flower ( 26 26 ) in the gutter, similar to Heawood 3866. This example is dated to 1705.

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript is foliated with the numbers i-iii + 1-15, 15a, 15b, 15[c], 15[d], 16-56, 58-99 + [iv], recto, upper right. The main body is numbered 1-15, 14, 51, 16-99 in Arabic numerals in brown ink, original to the production of the manuscript. Numbers in pencil have been added to ff. 15a-15b to replace the original erroneous numbers, while the two following blank folios (ff. 15[c]-15[d]) have been left unfoliated. The number 57 has been assigned to a folio no longer present in the manuscript except as a stub. The left endleaves are numbered i-iii in Roman numerals in pencil.

collation.p: The manuscript consists of 13 quires, of which two are ternia, three are quinia and the rest are quaternia. The left endleaves are included in the main quire structure.

list.item: Quire 68+1 ff. 36-44 The first folio is a singleton attached to the quire.
Quire 88-1 ff. 53-56, 58-60 The fifth folio has been lost, with loss of text.
Quires 9-138-1 ff. 61-99 The last folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.

supportDesc.condition: There is a tear in f. 14, and occsional small tears from the edges of other folios. There is some mild creasing and occasional areas of dirt.

layoutDesc.layout:
A single column of 21-24 lines of Greek text. 180 135
The line and page divisions correspond to those of the exemplar

handNote.p: The main Greek text was copied in direct imitation of the early medieval western European majuscule script of the exemplar. In accordance with the exemplar, diacritics are largely absent, but the double dot often appears on iota upsilon, and accents of anomalous form occasionally appear, while the punctuation marks used are the lower and middle points.
The Latin text, by the same hand, likewise imitates the form of the exemplar, in this case an Anglo-Saxon minuscule script.

decoDesc.decoNote: The initial letters of many words are expanded, as in the exemplar, but without imitating the painted decoration applied to such letters there.

additions.p: The original text copied from the exemplar includes running headers identifying the current epistle.
On f. iii recto a later hand using black ink has copied the text of f. 1r, imitating its script and layout.

On the front pastedown is a note dated 1839 recording the origin of the manuscript: This MS of St Paul's Epistles (one of the books bequeathed to Trinity College by Dr Richard Bentley) is a transcript of the Codex Boernerianus which belongs to the Royal Library at Dresden. See Horne's Introduction Vol II p 99 fifth edition, Wetstein's Prolegomena ad Novi Testamenti Tom II p. 9 and especially Kuster Preface to the Amsterdam reprint of Mill's Greek Testament, fol. 1710 pagina penultima. I.W. 1839.

binding.p: 19th-century quarter leather binding over millboards, with marbled paper covering and plain pastedowns. The title Paul Epist Gr Lat MS is tooled in gold on a red label on the spine, and the classmark appears on patches.

history.origin: Copied for the philologist Richard Bentley (1662-1742) Bentley, Richard, 1662-1742 , Master of Trinity, probably in 1719, when he borrowed the Codex Boernerianus.
history.acquisition: Bequeathed to Trinity College by Bentley.

availability.p: Visitors to Trinity College who wish to consult Special Collections material are required to apply to the Library in advance of their visit. For information on eligibility and admission procedures see: Trinity College: Information for Readers.

monogr.title: The western manuscripts in the library of Trinity College: a descriptive catalogue

analytic.title: Die griechisch-lateinische Paulus-Handschrift der Reichenau "Codex Paulinus Augiensis" (Cambridge, Trinity College B.17.1)
